page.title: 09 HOME LIFE
page.content:
A DAY IN THE LIFE OF BENJAMIN BRYANT.
I am nine years old and I live in Far Oakridge. On Saturdays I normally get up and look at magazines before I have my breakfast and then I get dressed and go shopping in Stroud. When we get home we have lunch and then go to a pheasant farm in North Cerney. At the farm we go fishing and sometimes shooting and my two brothers 'bit' the baby pheasant chicks that are about four weeks old. Sometimes there is a power cut and some of them will die so we have to warm them up. When we get home from the farm I ride my bike and then read the paper and help Mum with the ironing and then we have our dinner.When we are in bed we muck around until my Dad will tell us to get into bed.
